title: Move ninja build to pytorch-dockerfiles
body_html:
In .jenkins/pytorch/test.sh we have:

# JIT C++ extensions require ninja.
git clone https://github.com/ninja-build/ninja --quiet
pushd ninja
python ./configure.py --bootstrap
export PATH="$PWD:$PATH"
popd

This shouldn't happen in the test script; we should install ninja in our Docker image and then use that installation directly.

CC @goldsborough who added it in 390d542

body:
In `.jenkins/pytorch/test.sh` we have:

```
# JIT C++ extensions require ninja.
git clone https://github.com/ninja-build/ninja --quiet
pushd ninja
python ./configure.py --bootstrap
export PATH="$PWD:$PATH"
popd
```

This shouldn't happen in the test script; we should install ninja in our Docker image and then use that installation directly.

CC @goldsborough who added it in 390d542db2bcc884c33c3a81d56576b56ede72cd
